intro: Castalia crassifolia, commonly known as the thick-leaved castalia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, thick, leathery leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its showy, five-petaled flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom during the wet season. Castalia crassifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along riverbanks.
